commit.message:
Set archive prefix for signed releases (#1702)

* Set archive prefix for signed releases

This makes it so the signed release archives extract to a subdirectory
named with the tag without the leading 'v', e.g. "openexr-3.2.4". The release tarball has the same name.

Signed-off-by: Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com>

* Set job-specific write permission

Signed-off-by: Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com>

---------

Signed-off-by: Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com>

verification.payload:
tree 5194aeaed6b22147f2fd1da4dfcf8e4c92a4be88
parent e39ec0c817476e26cbf3e601e52a0fabaaf80dc0
author Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com> 1711929633 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1711929633 -0700

Set archive prefix for signed releases (#1702)

* Set archive prefix for signed releases

This makes it so the signed release archives extract to a subdirectory
named with the tag without the leading 'v', e.g. "openexr-3.2.4". The release tarball has the same name.

Signed-off-by: Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com>

* Set job-specific write permission

Signed-off-by: Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com>

---------

Signed-off-by: Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com>

commit.message:
Build website on windows/macos, and remote unnecessary installs (#1701)

Readthedocs builds the website on ubuntu-20.04, so technically that's
the only system that requires the website to build properly, but
developers contributing to the website may work on Windows or macOS,
so this confirms that it builds properly there, too.

Now that the test image files are no longer generated at build time,
no need to install imagemagic and openexr or run the test_image.py
script.

Signed-off-by: Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com>

verification.payload:
tree dd24954f0e2ebb05f03ca2da74f2fd1786df205f
parent 9d3e061a0b4090f268eee50e84fcccf5cbcad9ed
author Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com> 1711929109 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1711929109 -0700

Build website on windows/macos, and remote unnecessary installs (#1701)

Readthedocs builds the website on ubuntu-20.04, so technically that's
the only system that requires the website to build properly, but
developers contributing to the website may work on Windows or macOS,
so this confirms that it builds properly there, too.

Now that the test image files are no longer generated at build time,
no need to install imagemagic and openexr or run the test_image.py
script.

Signed-off-by: Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com>

commit.message:
Improve workflow files (#1693)

- Per OpenSSF, permissions should be read at the top level, with
  additional permissions only for the necessary run.
- Add .github/dependabot.yml
- Fix a typo in the website_workflow's filters.
- Run the snyk-scan only on the main repo, not forks, since it
  requires secrets.

Signed-off-by: Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com>

verification.payload:
tree b4c9d43c4c331bf9801a255826437d99a7793a30
parent 0e92e7d40b4fa304b534d9a04e9495454cf85f49
author Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com> 1711472019 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1711472019 -0700

Improve workflow files (#1693)

- Per OpenSSF, permissions should be read at the top level, with
  additional permissions only for the necessary run.
- Add .github/dependabot.yml
- Fix a typo in the website_workflow's filters.
- Run the snyk-scan only on the main repo, not forks, since it
  requires secrets.

Signed-off-by: Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com>

commit.message:
Update scorecard v2.3.1 (#1686)

Fix Scorecard breaking due to not being able to sign the results. Scorecard uses Sigstore tool to sign its results and Sigstore has done an update (https://blog.sigstore.dev/tuf-root-update/). This update is not compatible with older Scorecard versions (for example, v.2.1.2 used here), but Scorecard v2.3.1 is compatible with Sigstore changes.

Signed-off-by: Gabriela Gutierrez <gabigutierrez@google.com>

verification.payload:
tree 1854701a531d6f0cfcd894951c0af91cd1191247
parent bfbdccb48269ce7d45199098406e3d9743d55b77
author Gabriela Gutierrez <gabigutierrez@google.com> 1711152250 +0000
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1711152250 -0700

Update scorecard v2.3.1 (#1686)

Fix Scorecard breaking due to not being able to sign the results. Scorecard uses Sigstore tool to sign its results and Sigstore has done an update (https://blog.sigstore.dev/tuf-root-update/). This update is not compatible with older Scorecard versions (for example, v.2.1.2 used here), but Scorecard v2.3.1 is compatible with Sigstore changes.

Signed-off-by: Gabriela Gutierrez <gabigutierrez@google.com>

commit.message:
Fix typo causing prefix len to be wrong (#1684)

When constructing the decompress side of dwaa/b compression support,
simple typo when computing the prefix length as distance between
pointers causing the length to be wrong, triggering csc decompression
values to be wrong when decompressed.

Signed-off-by: Kimball Thurston <kdt3rd@gmail.com>

verification.payload:
tree 538c485f5ed4d3be6b931a6268da1b0727300855
parent 9fa6984f2274c863b0e6e86132d15d5837f974cb
author Kimball Thurston <kdt3rd@gmail.com> 1711063408 +1300
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1711063408 -0700

Fix typo causing prefix len to be wrong (#1684)

When constructing the decompress side of dwaa/b compression support,
simple typo when computing the prefix length as distance between
pointers causing the length to be wrong, triggering csc decompression
values to be wrong when decompressed.

Signed-off-by: Kimball Thurston <kdt3rd@gmail.com>

commit.message:
CMake packaging fix. (#1674)

* CMake packaging fix.

Add find_dependency for the new dependency libdeflate, and remove the REQUIRED flag. find_dependency will pickup the correct flag from the calling find_package call.

Signed-off-by: Peter Steneteg <peter@steneteg.se>

* find_dependency only if libdeflate_FOUND

Signed-off-by: Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com>

* Need to expand the libdeflate_FOUND variable at configure_file time

Signed-off-by: Peter Steneteg <peter@steneteg.se>

---------

Signed-off-by: Peter Steneteg <peter@steneteg.se>
Signed-off-by: Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com>
Co-authored-by: Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com>

verification.payload:
tree 8993675b19a674f066c89606b59889c605e67890
parent 00a11d8c360444060310f33128d7aff352948364
author Peter Steneteg <peter@steneteg.se> 1710786092 +0100
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1710786092 -0700

CMake packaging fix. (#1674)

* CMake packaging fix.

Add find_dependency for the new dependency libdeflate, and remove the REQUIRED flag. find_dependency will pickup the correct flag from the calling find_package call.

Signed-off-by: Peter Steneteg <peter@steneteg.se>

* find_dependency only if libdeflate_FOUND

Signed-off-by: Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com>

* Need to expand the libdeflate_FOUND variable at configure_file time

Signed-off-by: Peter Steneteg <peter@steneteg.se>

---------

Signed-off-by: Peter Steneteg <peter@steneteg.se>
Signed-off-by: Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com>
Co-authored-by: Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com>

commit.message:
Replace auto-generation of test image .jpgs with explicit sidecars (#1667)

Automatically generating .jpg images for display under "Test Images"
as a step in building the website seemed like a good idea a the time,
but is too hard to maintain. I couldn't get the process to work across
Linux, macOS, and Windows, which means no Windows/macOS-based
developers can contribute to the website.

The https://github.com/AcademySoftwareFoundation/openexr-images repo
now has a permenant sidecar .jpg file associated with each .exr which
serves as a proxy for display on the website.

The `website/scripts/test_images.py` is still in place but is now to
be run manually to generate the website `.rst` and the associated
`.rst` files describing each image. Anyone providing additional test
images to the`openexr-image` repo should contribute an associated
`.jpg` for display.

To contribute additional images, first add the images to the image
repo, then run the `website/scripts/test_image.py`, and commit the
new/modified `.rst` files(s).

Signed-off-by: Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com>

verification.payload:

parent 5f18d4854dc86498c492cd0f8b0ecfc432805c69
author Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com> 1710785866 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1710785866 -0700

commit.message:
register clang-format run to avoid blame

Run clang-format

Signed-off-by: Kimball Thurston <kdt3rd@gmail.com>

Simplify and clarify names for internal convenience macros

The macros used to check the context arguments and define a part to
reduce boilerplate were confusingly named and with collapsing type
names, creating duplicate / unnecessary variables

Signed-off-by: Kimball Thurston <kdt3rd@gmail.com>

disable some warnings when compiling deflate internally

Signed-off-by: Kimball Thurston <kdt3rd@gmail.com>

collapse internal types to avoid warnings

rename the internal struct to match the priv struct in the context
declaration, such that we can avoid extra variables and just access the
context, and make a similar change for part.

Signed-off-by: Kimball Thurston <kdt3rd@gmail.com>

Pin RTD to sphinx 5.3 (#1673)

Sphinx handling of `html_logo` and `html_favicon` changed in version 6,
but changing to the documented logo_url and favicon_url still doesn't
work for some reason. But Sphinx 5.3 works, so let's pin to that. This
will need to get sorted out at some point, when there's a need to move
to a newer sphinx.

Signed-off-by: Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com>

Pin RTD to sphinx 5.3 (#1673)

Sphinx handling of `html_logo` and `html_favicon` changed in version 6,
but changing to the documented logo_url and favicon_url still doesn't
work for some reason. But Sphinx 5.3 works, so let's pin to that. This
will need to get sorted out at some point, when there's a need to move
to a newer sphinx.

Signed-off-by: Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com>

commit.message:
Improve workflow filters (#1668)

Run the ci_workflow and website_workflow only on changes to the
appropriate source files and workflow files.

Signed-off-by: Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com>

commit.message:
Add link to PR description to readthedocs build (#1664)

Readthedocs triggers a build on PR, and a link is provided in the PR
checks, but it's obscure. This action adds a link to the PR
description, but only for PR's that actually modify the website.

Signed-off-by: Cary Phillips <cary@ilm.com>
